title: 6.4: Complex Systems
summary: Combine all learned concepts to create production-ready complex particle systems
intro: In this final lesson, you'll combine all the concepts learned throughout the course to create a complex, production-ready particle system. You'll create a complete system from scratch that uses multiple techniques including time-based properties, randomness, vector operations, direction updates, and angle rotation.
steps: Create a SystemBlock - this is the root of your particle system
Add UpdateDirectionBlock to modify particle direction over time
Use system Time to create direction variation
Add UpdatePositionBlock to handle particle movement
Create a CreateParticleBlock with random color and size using ParticleRandomBlock
Set lockMode to OncePerParticle for consistent random values
Add a SphereShapeBlock with radius input
Add time-based color fade using Age and Lifetime
Multiply initial color by fade factor for smooth fading
Add time-based size growth using age ratio
Chain all blocks: UpdatePosition → UpdateColor → UpdateSize → UpdateAngle → SystemBlock
Add a ParticleTextureSourceBlock to provide a texture
Observe the complex, multi-layered particle effect

blocks.name: Complex System Integration
blocks.description: This lesson combines multiple blocks and techniques: UpdateDirectionBlock, ParticleRandomBlock, time-based calculations, vector operations, and angle updates. All working together to create a sophisticated effect.

codeCopy: Complex particle systems combine multiple techniques to create rich, dynamic effects. This system uses randomness for variation, time-based calculations for evolution over time, direction updates for dynamic movement, and angle rotation for visual interest. The key is organizing these techniques into a coherent block chain that flows logically from creation to final output.
objectives: Combine multiple techniques in one system
Understand how different techniques work together
Design sophisticated particle systems from scratch

commonMistakes.explanation: Adding too many effects can make the system hard to understand and debug. Start simple and add complexity gradually.
commonMistakes.solution: Build systems incrementally. Start with basic movement, then add color, then size, then advanced features. Test at each step.

commonMistakes.explanation: Complex systems need clear organization. Random blocks connected in confusing ways are hard to debug and maintain.
commonMistakes.solution: Organize blocks in logical order: Creation → Shape → Direction → Position → Color → Size → Angle → System. Keep related calculations together.

homework: Create your own complex particle system combining 5+ techniques
Experiment with different combinations of effects
Optimize a complex system for performance
Create a themed effect (fire, magic, explosion) using multiple techniques
Document your complex system for future reference
